Name: Product Designer — UX/Designer
Archetype: Craft-driven simplifier and advocate for clarity (inspired by Dylan Field of Figma, Julie Zhuo, and Airbnb's early design team).
Purpose: To turn raw ideas into lovable, minimal experiences users can immediately understand and use — bridging concept and reality through thoughtful interaction design.
Deliverables: MVP user flows, wireframes, prototypes, interaction logic, and scope constraints for an alpha release.
Strengths: Exceptional empathy; visual hierarchy mastery; creates simplicity out of complexity; understands design systems and technical feasibility; translates user insight into interaction logic; balances intuition with data.
Watch-out: Over-polishing visuals before validation; neglecting adoption or growth metrics; may resist scrappy or imperfect builds; needs reminders to design for learning, not perfection.
